text: When I read stories like this one, or when I talk to Dreamers in the halls of Congress, I know I am looking at our future. They are brave and courageous individuals who represent the best of this country. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/10/us/dreamers-daca-stories.html

For those wondering how Trump, Paul Ryan and Republicans in DC were going to pay for the unpopular $1.5 trillion #GOPTaxScam, you've got your answer.

The #TrumpBudget is coming after our seniors, children with disabilities and working families. It also calls for annual 2 percent cuts to non-defense domestic programs beginning after 2019.

America’s infrastructure is broken. But instead of making real investments to fix it, @realdonaldtrump wants to pass the burden on to local governments & let private companies make up the difference. Americans want safer roads & bridges – not higher tolls. https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/trump-tolls-infrastructure_us_5a81b8bbe4b08dfc930673bb

The private sector is best equipped to build, deploy & secure 5G networks, & any proposals that consider nationalizing these networks will only have a chilling effect on private investment & result in a radical shift in the management of our nation’s telecommunication’s networks.

What we’re seeing is an Administration that sides with greedy companies that rip off consumers. https://www.cnbc.com/2018/02/12/trumps-consumer-protection-bureau-reportedly-drops-lawsuit-alleging-predatory-lending.html
If you were wondering how Trump plans to pay for his tax cuts for billionaires and corporations, now you know: with $1.8 trillion in cuts to Medicare, Medicaid and Social Security.

Asma Jahangir was a legendary figure in the human rights community. She personified the best of humanity, fighting for democracy, political rights & gender quality. We will sorely miss the light she brought to humankind, using it to illuminate the darkest abuses in our world. https://twitter.com/Malala/status/962644186364301312 QT @Malala Heartbroken that we lost Asma Jahangir - a saviour of democracy and human rights. 

I met her a week ago in Oxford. I cannot believe she is no more among us. The best tribute to her is to continue her fight for human rights and democracy. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DVv_xTNWkAAhraL.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DVv_xTMX0AAqSWq.jpg

This weekend, Iran committed an unprecedented, blatant act of aggression against our close friend and ally, Israel.

I commend Israel for its vigorous response, and the American people unequivocally support Israel's right to defend itself: http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/US-Senator-Ted-Cruz-issues-statement-condemning-Iran-542366#/

Instead of creating more giveaways to corporate America, we should be eliminating corporate tax loopholes and using this revenue to directly invest over $1 trillion to modernize our nation’s infrastructure and create 15 million good-paying jobs.

I meet Dreamers every week. They are here walking the halls of Congress all the time. They scrape together enough for travel, take time off their jobs, and find places to stay – all because they feel like they have to be here so we see them. Their futures are in our hands.
Hey big spenders, don't complain if you lose power http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/hey-big-spenders-dont-complain-if-you-lose-power/article/2648779

Whenever someone tells you your dreams aren't achievable, whenever you feel alone, whenever you find yourself in a room where there aren't a lot of people who look like you, remember that you have an entire community in that room with you, all of us cheering you on. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DV1_mt8WAAAF9mC.jpg

Trump is right to talk about the need to rebuild our infrastructure, but his proposal is dead wrong. Trump would encourage states to sell our nation’s highways, bridges, and other vital infrastructure to Wall Street and saddle Americans with new tolls and fees.

The Trump budget is morally bankrupt and bad economic policy. It pays for his tax breaks for the rich and large corporations by slashing Medicaid by $1.3 trillion, cutting Medicare by $554 billion and slicing $10 billion from the Social Security Disability Insurance Program.
